description: Provisions an IP address range to use with your Amazon Web Services resources through bring your own IP addresses (BYOIP) and creates a corresponding address pool. After the address range is provisioned, it is ready to be advertised using AdvertiseByoipCidr. For more information, see Bring your own IP addresses (BYOIP) in the Global Accelerator Developer Guide.

parameters.name: Cidr
parameters.description: The public IPv4 address range, in CIDR notation. The most specific IP prefix that you can specify is /24. The address range cannot overlap with another address range that you've brought to this Amazon Web Services Region or another Region. For more information, see Bring your own IP addresses (BYOIP) in the Global Accelerator Developer Guide.

parameters.name: CidrAuthorizationContext
parameters.description: A signed document that proves that you are authorized to bring the specified IP address range to Amazon using BYOIP. The plain-text authorization message for the prefix and account. The signed authorization message for the prefix and account.

nested_params.name: Message
nested_params.description: The plain-text authorization message for the prefix and account.

nested_params.name: Signature
nested_params.description: The signed authorization message for the prefix and account.

nested_items.name: Cidr
nested_items.description: The address range, in CIDR notation.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the address pool.

nested_items.name: Events
nested_items.description: A history of status changes for an IP address range that you bring to Global Accelerator through bring your own IP address (BYOIP).

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: A string that contains an Event message describing changes that you make in the status of an IP address range that you bring to Global Accelerator through bring your own IP address (BYOIP).

nested_items.name: Timestamp
nested_items.description: A timestamp for when you make a status change for an IP address range that you bring to Global Accelerator through bring your own IP address (BYOIP).
